website_summaries.verdict: If you're looking for a rugged pocket shooter that you can take anywhere without worry, the Panasonic Lumix DMC-TS20 is an inexpensive option. Its lens isn't the sharpest, and noise reduction smears away image detail at higher ISOs, but the camera performs admirably in good light.

customer_reviews.title: Followed the directions on the manual, but still WATER DAMAGED!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, my unit got water-damaged few weeks after the 1-year warranty ran out. It was a decent camera while it lasted. Took some great photos on our family beach vacations. I'm very meticulous when it comes to my electronics, and I took great care FOLLOWING DIRECTIONS ON CLEANING AND MAINTAINING RUBBER SEALS on the camera. Despite this, water got inside shortly after the warranty period ran out. Highly disappointed! Before the purchase, I did notice that there were negative reviews about water damage, but I figured people weren't reading the manual and following care directions on rubber seals. I was mistaken! It appears there may be design/manufacturing defect on the water-proof seals on this unit. Very dissatisfied with this product!!
customer_reviews.author: Consumer1

customer_reviews.title: Absolute must for water!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this two years ago to have a camera to take with us on vacation. We wanted a camera that could get a little bit wet and not be ruined. This camera stated it could be submerged, so we decided to take it to the local public pool to test it out before our vacation. All I can say is wow! We would go completely under the water and take pictures of the kids swimming and diving. This camera took amazing pictures and still works to this day. We took the camera with us to Yellowstone and used it throughout the whole vacation. There was no fogging of the lense noted after water use.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great for our trip...then 3 days later won't turn on
customer_reviews.text: The camera worked awesome for our cruise. We got great video as well as snorkeling pics. I rinsed it with fresh water after the snorkeling. It took awesome pictures and never gave me any trouble. Battery held for a long time as well. 3 days after vacation, I took the camera out to take a picture at home and it wouldn't turn on. I charged up the battery just in case it can inadvertently run down. Put it back in, still nothing. I'm sad because it was a great camera. Maybe I got a lemon battery or something. They have to give me a refund because the one I ordered is not available to give me an exchange. :(
customer_reviews.author: Cat Woman

customer_reviews.title: Hawaii Vacation!!
customer_reviews.text: My Husband and I took this camera to Hawaii. We loved it. Other reviews said it leaked so that had us a bit concerned but we found that with the correct care (Soaking in clean water for 10 minutes after use) this camera was the PERFECT choice for us :) We had our good Cannon camera for everyday dry pictures and this one for our possible water shots. It was so light weight and small carrying 2 cameras worked for us! I took some really awesome underwater pictures of fish and corral while snorkeling on several occasions as well as pictures from when we swam out to a waterfall. I would highly recommend this camera!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Great waterproof camera for vacations
customer_reviews.text: I bought this just a few days before my wife and I took a two week vacation in Hawaii. We discovered our previous (non-waterproof) digital camera, after many years of service, no longer turned on. Thankfully 2-day Prime shipping got this camera to us the day before we left! Overall we are very pleased with the usability of the camera and quality of the photos. I read that most people now tend to use the cameras on their smartphones, or own higher-end cameras such as DSLRs. We enjoy bringing an easy to carry camera that we take with us to the beach and into the water...plus on future vacations. This camera was highly reviewed and I can see why.
customer_reviews.author: Kari M.

customer_reviews.title: Dead in the Water
customer_reviews.text: My brand-new Lumix took 200 photos in an hour of snorkeling in the ocean, and then it died permanently like quite a few of the other reviewers' Lumixes. I figure that's a little less than $1 a photo, which would have been a normal price in the old film-camera days (it also cost around $3 for Costco's service to rescue the photos from the card). Is it under warantee? Other reviewers don't hold out much hope -- anyway it will be too late for this trip. So if you are planning a snorkeling vacation with several times in the water, I suggest you buy three or four of these cameras so you'll have a new one ready for each dive.
customer_reviews.author: Mae

customer_reviews.title: Meh...
customer_reviews.text: It got wet from a snorkel trip and it stopped working for a little. I think its working again. Its ok for the money. I wish I had saved and bought a better camera but for the price you get what you pay for. The pics came out pretty good. Not very user friendly. A warning comes up every time you turn it on, I can’t figure how to make it stop coming up. Took forever to learn how to play video back. The review of pics doesn’t always show if its a video and i have erased videos thinking it was just a bad pic. Meh, cheap, works kinda....save and buy better is my advice though.
customer_reviews.author: Jeli314

customer_reviews.title: Get the Panasonic Lumix!
customer_reviews.text: For those looking for a good point & shoot digital camera - look no further! This digital camera takes excellent pics (16.1MP) - and it is a fast operating camera. It let's you take pics quickly! The case of the camera is also rather rugged - which is what attracted me to the camera. I have not tested the waterproof capabilities of the camera, but I have no doubt about this - the battery compartment and memory card doors have nice, soft rubber protection to keep the water out. The camera also features a "locking" switch to really close up the doors tightly. I'm very pleased with the decision to purchase this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Arizona Sportsman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter and she loves it. It takes great pictures for what it is. It is NOT a $500.00 dollar DSLR!!!! Don't expect that kind of quality. For a shoot and point camera this is very good quality and actually rivals my older Cannon Power Shot for close shoots (like out to about 50 feet). I intend to get one to take fishing and when I travel on my motorcycle tours. She did drop hers a couple of times on really hard ground and no problems. The water stays out well too. We have only used it snorkeling at about 15 feet. The underwater shots are good, assuming the water is fairly clear.
customer_reviews.author: William E. Strack

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Great Pics
customer_reviews.text: It's not going to win any "Picture of the Year" awards but it is very durable, easy to use and great underwater. The only complaint is that the batteries died after a year.
customer_reviews.author: Tanner

customer_reviews.title: Never turned on
customer_reviews.text: Received the package quickly and well packaged; Amazon ROCKS! Opened it up, charged the battery, read the directions, put the battery in, and tried to turn it on. Error. Wouldn't even turn on. Looked in the user manual to see if there was anything about this error. Nothing. Checked with customer service and it would need shipped in for service... before it was ever used. I sent it back to amazon and got an Olympus, which was the only thing available locally and we needed our camera right away by this point, and loved it!
customer_reviews.author: Cyd

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Don't thing you'll capture any masterpieces with this, it survived three days in the South China sea, moist environment, in and out of the water, hot and cool, dives down to about 15'. A few drops of leakage, but they stayed in the gasket, and never a problem. It's easy to use, the menus are simple, ample buttons and sizes. The only downside is the volume of the autofocus when using the video; it's constantly going and is loud enough to be heard, at least in the background, in spite of all other audio. Underwater, rather than hearing silence, small clicks, etc, you'll hear that focus grinding away...
customer_reviews.author: Nick Burns

customer_reviews.title: works good so far, kid loves it
customer_reviews.text: I read, read, re-read many many reviews about several cameras in the class. Settled on this one as it seemed to get improved ratings recently - from pretty good to quite good. My son loves it and its working well. He likes the slim profile and expected durability. Haven't challenged its water proof features. But we wanted it for weather resistance and don't plan on going deep w it. But if we drop it in a bog or snow, get rained on we expect it to work. Compact and shipping was FAST. Edit 4-2-13: Camera holding up well, son still loves it. We head out on a 3 wk vacation soon; that may be a good trial for it.
customer_reviews.author: Marjorie W. Dunaway

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera but it leaks.
customer_reviews.text: The camera took great pictures in the water. It took even better videos in the water while I was snorkeling. Everything about it was simple to understand and operate. The problem with it is that it started leaking the third time I used it. When I opened the camera after coming out of the water snorkeling for just a few minutes there was drops of water on the battery and inside the case. I sent it back to the factory under warranty and am waiting to hear from them. I am giving it only two stars because a waterproof camera which is not waterproof is useless.
customer_reviews.author: Agapemou

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little camera
customer_reviews.text: I got this for a snorkeling excursion while on a cruise. It was great. I used it in the water and got excellent results. Being able to make movies and take pix underwater really made it fun and I have plenty of memories recorded. I rinsed and dried it up and used it for normal shooting the next day. I had no problems with it. It worked really well in all conditions and has different settings for different lighting situations. The camera is small and lightweight and easy to use. No complaints here. This is one video I took during the excursion, snorkeling in Cozumel.
customer_reviews.author: Mal

customer_reviews.title: Sea water
customer_reviews.text: This works very well underwater and works great in salt water!. I bought this for my vacation and it worked wonderfully! I had no worries that is was going to leak which is a good thing because I had bought an underwater case for my iphone and got scared after testing it. After using this camera in sea water you need to soak it in clean unsalted water for at least an hour before opening it. The only reason why I gave it 4 stars and not 5 is because the quality for the underwater could be a little better, other then that a great camera above and below water :)
customer_reviews.author: Jaq

customer_reviews.title: Great - However
customer_reviews.text: This is a great camera however it claims to be waterproof and maybe it is. After a year of use without problem I just happened to take it along on a cruise and while skin diving (all latches/seals closed per instructions) for 30 minutes in a depth of 12 feet moisture entered the camera and that was nearly the end of it. I sent it to the manufacturer and they warrant the equipment except when it is a moisture issue. SO I bought another one but it will not be submerged in water. I use this for work constantly taking 60 photos 5 days a week . . . its awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera So Far
customer_reviews.text: Love this camera, bought this to replace a dying Casio camera. The only gripe I really have about this, is the bracketing shot function. This camera can only take bracketing shots at 3 megapixels instead of the 16 megapixels. Also the quality of picture doesn't seem to follow the mold of Panasonic Lumix camera. But I did pay less than $150, and it's only when I take pictures at night where the quality of pictures don't hold true. But for a point and shoot camera, this one definitely does its job. Great camera, awesome design, and love the majority of the features (especially the panoramic shot function)
customer_reviews.author: Aloha NinjaTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Water leaked in 2nd time using it underwater - DON'T BUY!!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this camera last summer after reading many, many reviews. We took it to Cozumel last July 2012. We were very happy with the pictures and video this camera took while we were snorkeling. We used the camera out of the water for several months afterwards. We just took the camera back to Cozumel last month, and the first day we used it underwater, water leaked in. We were extremely upset that we do not have pictures from our last trip to Cozumel. My husband has searched for a replacement gasket to try to make the camera waterproof, but he has been unable to find one. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Carla D.

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: I was in a pinch to get a waterproof digital camera for a once in a lifetime vacation. More specifically I was expecting this camera to work underwater. While I'm not a camera fanatic I will say this took decent pictures underwater. What's funny was I was snorkeling and I couldn't see more than a half foot in any direction so I just randomly snapped photos. The random shots came out quite well even though they are a little greenish. This camera has been durable, slick looking, and great battery life.
customer_reviews.author: AnonymousOne

customer_reviews.title: Gift for kid, good rough/safe camera for all ages!
customer_reviews.text: Does NOT come with memory card. I was not impressed by bulk etc. but it seems great so far! Everything 'mechanical' has a snug secure fit and the software is 'standard'. Have not tried it under water but basic setup and first few photos have worked out great used as a 'regular' camera. We got it for a seven year old and she loves it, and to be honest I would get one for myself if I needed one! Seems like a great camera! (Will come back and add if it proves to not be the case!)
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: great water proof camera!
customer_reviews.text: I went though a number of water proof cameras before this one, fuji and Olympus mostly. Having numours and annoying buying and returning, I desiced to order the TS20 after reading reviews on amazon and consumer reports (another great source for product reviews) This camera scored reitivaly high compared to other water proof camera. When I tryed it out, I loved it instantly. Its very responsive, takes great pictures, and quick, fast start up time, is compact, and the menu is easily to guide through, highly recommend this camera. amazing value for the price
customer_reviews.author: kyle

customer_reviews.title: Decent pix; love the usability
customer_reviews.text: Got this for our honeymoon since I knew we would be in a wet environment and I didn't want to worry about our camera getting slightly damp. Found this camera to be very easy to use. The pictures weren't the best ever, but they were pretty good. I would say on par with most basic cameras in this price range. We took it on the beach, to the pool, through rain forests & downpours: it was really nice not having to worry about keeping it "safe." I could just take pictures regardless the weather. Very pleased with the pix when I got home & uploaded them.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Fonkert

customer_reviews.title: Long Term Review - Very Happy with this product.
customer_reviews.text: Long term review of camera. We have had a couple of so called water proof camera end up not living up to their claim. This one has proven itself time and time again. Very happy with the product. Seller was also prompt and everything as described.
customer_reviews.author: zincguy

customer_reviews.title: and seemed to be a great choice. It worked for a few vacations
customer_reviews.text: Our vacations are primarily beach oriented. The Panasonic DMC-TS20 was reasonably priced ,and seemed to be a great choice. It worked for a few vacations. It never leaked, as a number of people complained, but the LCD display failed; the camera was unusable. Luckily, the pictures survived on the memory stick, and when we returned, loaded onto our computer. I intend to replace the camera, but I'll pay close attention to the reviews, and the ratings distribution. Definitely consider other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Greg M

customer_reviews.title: ok so far
customer_reviews.text: arrived promptly in excellent condition used it once, really, in Zion's Virgin River Narrows - under VERY difficult lighting conditions I did not do the camera justice by having a week prior to get used to it - it was a last minute purchase main reason for chosing this camera was the correct price point on features and being waterproof this camera allows water to get behind the body palter - by design - I'm not sure how that would fare in sandy conditions in the long run
customer_reviews.author: Anthony J. Hitchings

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for a vacation to Barbados, but also plan to use it while hiking as I live in the Seattle are where it rains quite a bit. The pictures I took both underwater and above water are great with only a slight variation from my non-waterproof Lumix camera. (I almost destroyed the non-waterproof camera taking it to Ice Caves near me and using it to photograph Bald Eagles in the area.) The camera is lightweight with a bunch of different filter options. The video capture is also impressive.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Perfect budget tough camera
customer_reviews.text: I used this camera while on vacation in Hawaii and to take pictures during Hurricane Sandy. The camera worked fantastically in water or in crazy weather. The colors are a little off compared to similarly priced compact cameras (not waterproof) or more expensive tough cameras, butt for the price and the ability to take it underwater its worth it. The underwater pictures come out better if you're closer to the object, the colors are a lot more vivid. The camera does seem sensitive to rapid changes in humidity, but I followed the directions for drying it out and it was back to functioning in less than 30 minutes. For the price I paid, I'm really happy with this camera.
customer_reviews.author: austin_fan

customer_reviews.title: Best camera
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera! It works great for everything! it fits in my back pocket easily and takes amazing photos. If you use it in water make sure to get the underwater accessory kit. It is just a flotation strap but it keeps your camera from sinking or running off. Anti-shake on this is great I love that I can be in a moving vehicle and take a picture that turns out great. Plus with 2 kids who don't sit still I need action shots and this camera delivers.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Riherd

customer_reviews.title: Waaay Better than the Olympus I had before
customer_reviews.text: Pros: This camera is amazingly clear, user-friendly and dependable for the price!!! I bought it based on price + reviews and I am NOT DISAPPOINTED AT ALL! The photos are vivid and sharp, fast response, and video is just as great with one click recording. So very happy I made this choice. Cons: Battery died after one day of shooting and recording....but it was a LOT of shots and videos, and playbacks. So it's not a complete con. :) Overall: BUY IT! You won't regret it!
customer_reviews.author: groovytello

customer_reviews.title: not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: It was a great p/s camera while it worked. We used it underwater during 2 vacations with good results. This year it leaked and even after a dry rice treatment, it's not working. The door was shut properly, and I didn't dive. The battery / memory card was completely dry, so I'm assuming it leaked from some other opening. Seeing other reviews, I see that it's not a isolated issue. I'd expect better from Panasonic.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does more than expected
customer_reviews.text: My wife bought me this for use snorkeling--but it does so much more! It is truly a full-featured, yet very compact, camera with many extras (including video and panoramic capabilities). The only negative is that it is only good down to 16 feet--fine for snorkeling, but not for scuba diving. Great to take to the beach! It does not come with a memory card, which must be purchased seperately, but it uses the widely available SD type of card
customer_reviews.author: rgd

customer_reviews.title: Great for price.
customer_reviews.text: Picture quality is okay, but for the price, it is a cool little camera to take to the beach, snorkeling, or anywhere "rugged". It's tough, I love the color, and easy to use (dummy-proof). Tip: when I take it swimming in the ocean, I have it on a lanyard with a floatable key chain attached. I had to dive down a distance once when I accidentally dropped it while snorkeling...
customer_reviews.author: Joanne Fujito

customer_reviews.title: Failed twice
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera twice--the first time it locked up on me completely after only one use --none of the buttons would work and it wouldn't turn off so I returned it thinking it was a one time glitch. Second camera came in and after two uses it did almost exactly the same thing. This time all the buttons worked except the power button and we couldn't turn it off. We love everything about this camera other than the fact it failed for us twice. We are now looking for other options.
customer_reviews.author: gkjake

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: I brought this camera for a cruise to Mexico and to replace the camera I use for hiking and backpacking. I love the fact it is waterproof, shock proof and dust proof. These features combined with its lightweight and compact design make it perfect for outdoor activities like hiking or camping. It's also the perfect travel camera as it fits into pockets easily and does not need a case to protect it. The pictures are clear, the video is good and it's easy and fast to use.
customer_reviews.author: Arizonajones

customer_reviews.title: Good Underwater camera.
customer_reviews.text: Good Underwater camera. Out of water pictures are good not great. I have a Canon SLR, so I might be biased. This is a waterproof point at shoot that is easy to use underwater and takes pretty good pictures. Overall I've been happy with the camera as it suits my need for a camera to take snorkeling/kayaking/camping and not have to worry about getting it wet. I know other people who have had a lot of durability issues with underwater cameras. This one is easy to use and I haven't been worried about the seals or breaking it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Savvy

customer_reviews.title: 16 MP never looked so bad
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea why a camera with that many MPs takes such poor pictures. I guess it is just shabby material. It is definitely waterproof. I used it in the pool and ocean while on vacation. The pictures just look washed out. It is hard to describe but as many people said in other reviews, the picture quality is an issue. There again it is a waterproof camera for a little over a $100. I guess something had to give. I do think it is worth the price though.
customer_reviews.author: Jason I

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof indeed
customer_reviews.text: The camera is small and makes it easy for you to carry around especially at a water park. You can take picture of your kids playing in the water without caring about your camera getting wet. It takes videos too. However, it has very limited features. Don't expect it to be a professional grade camera. It has small lenses so image quality might not be as great, and the glass fogs if you keep it in your pocket so be sure to wipe it off before use. It is a great travel companion to capture those moments in environments that are not friendly to "heavy artillery" cameras.
customer_reviews.author: CALOi

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Bought this camera as replacement for Canon D10 which went around the world above and underwater, 1000's of pics and lots of abuse. Just wanted to try a less bulky camera, more mega pix. My enthusiasm lasted a few weeks. After using camera underwater the first time, battery and sd card were wet, camera went on/off by itself and then quit for good. Comparing the two waterproof cameras and quality of pictures, especially underwater, i will go back to the Canon D10 which will last longer than 60 minutes underwater.
customer_reviews.author: patrick

customer_reviews.title: It really is waterproof!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a waterproof camera for our vacation to Cancun a few months ago, as a previous tropical vacation resulted in my camera getting ruined. I also wanted to be able to take a camera under the water for our snorkeling adventures. I was very hesitant and nervous, but after submerging the camera in the water, I was able to take videos and pictures and the quality was really great. I am very happy with this camera; it is a great alternative if you do not want to take your phone with you somewhere.
customer_reviews.author: A. Forsythe

customer_reviews.title: A lot of money, for what?
customer_reviews.text: Very expensive camera, didn't last very long when used in water. The pictures were great and worked well on dry land, however the waterproofing isn't sufficient to make a claim of "waterproof." I teach video production and imagery and from what I've seen, this camera can't last. I went back to Canon.
customer_reviews.author: J. Calitree

customer_reviews.title: Good waterproof technology, easy to use, poor picture quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera to take with me into the field so I had a lightweight durable camera to take pictures of sample collection sites. This was relatively inexpensive and definitely durable enough to fit the bill. However, the picture quality was really quite poor. The pictures were dull in color and not sharp. As a camera for scientific field collection it is great, but I would never subsitute this camera for a better point and shoot or SLR when good quality photos are desired. Pros: Light weight, cool design, easy to use, inexpensive, durable Cons: Poor photo quality (flat color, dull)
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Little Camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is fantastic! I took a trip to Africa recently and got some really great shots from it, some turned out even better than the ones on my fancy expensive Canon SLR! I would definitely recommend this to anyone. It is small, easy to carry, easy to use, and takes great pictures. I have yet to figure out how to take pictures under water with it because they seem to always come out a little blurry, but I think those instances were because there wasn't enough lighting.
customer_reviews.author: BigAl

customer_reviews.title: Not good for indoor shots, but produces AMAZING outdoor photos
customer_reviews.text: After researching a lot of under-water camera, I bought this one. It takes GORGEOUS bright color photos. However, I have noted that this is only for outside photos. Indoor photos are very dark. But we've taken it to the community pool a lot over 2 summers now. Really gorgeous pool photos (professional quality). Absolutely no problems with getting the camera wet. Works like a charm, highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Headache
customer_reviews.text: Initially I loved the camera and was satisfied with it. I have had it for 8 months now, but have only used it for 3 trips. For the first two it worked perfectly. But on my last trip it suddenly went rogue and turns on but the top buttons are not working so I can't either take pictures or turn it off. Thankfully I bought insurance and I am sending it asap. It is not a reliable camera. I would consider other options.
customer_reviews.author: LizPL

customer_reviews.title: Great while it lasted - about 1 day.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this camera for a trip to St. John. It worked fine for the first part of the first day, then started to fog up, which lasted the rest of the day. The next day it seemed to have recovered (out of the water), but as soon as we started using it while snorkeling it fogged up again; then went into a loop where it was flashing something on the screen, then off, then on... Finally, it just stopped working altogether. We definitely did not open the camera while at the beach, and it never got wet inside. It was a very disappointing purchase and we won't consider another Panasonic "underwater" camera.
customer_reviews.author: mikev

customer_reviews.title: Panasonic Lumix TS20.16 New user comments
customer_reviews.text: It takes awhile to get used to its operation. Not always easy to see what you are getting a picture of when under water. And responds poorly to movement (picture turns out to be out of focus) underwater. Hopefully with more use I'll better understand what is doable and what is not. On the definite plus side it did not leak. It takes great out of water shots. Video mode is easy to use. Didn't like the fogging of the lenses a full night after using it under water. Defogging instructions do work, just takes awhile.
customer_reviews.author: Topper

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality photos
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift due to it's 4 out of 5 star rating. I really can't see how people are rating it so high. The pictures it takes look similar to what I used to take on pre smart-phone phones. The person I bought this for was thankful but I could tell after seeing the photos she was disappointed. I was too. We're now looking for a replacement camera as I'm embarrassed I bought such a poor camera as a gift for someone.
customer_reviews.author: YeahItsMe72

customer_reviews.title: Tough and waterproof at the bottom of a lake
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera 3 years ago and really enjoyed it. I took it to a lake with a zip line and my wrist strap broke when I went in. Spent hours looking for it but no luck due to the muddy water and no visibility. came back 5 days later and finally found it.it was at least 10 feet deep where its at all that time.I think that exceeds my expectation by a mile.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Family Camera!
customer_reviews.text: We actually have two of these now - and we use them all the time. They are user-friendly, super durable, well-priced, and versatile. We returned a Fuji XP (the comparable all-weather version) because the quality and features did not compare to the Lumix. We have taken them snorkeling, kayaking, camping, and to various amusement parks with no problems at all. Highly recommend this camera to get the job done!
customer_reviews.author: tdk

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to buy the Nikon cool pix but could not afforded so I wheat for this one I had it for about a year now and it has not let me down, I use it in or out of water and it takes good looking pictures for what you pay for they are not the best pictures out there but for what you pay for it is good and they are not bad either, the flash works good everything works good.
customer_reviews.author: Karlylli web

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had any issues with it so far. Some of the learning curve in how to take video or picture has been a bit cumbersome and caused me to miss a few good shots. Didn't test the waterproof part and hope to not have to. The cover for the battery/SD card is where I think most are complaining about the waterproof failures and I could see it loosening/wearing out at some point.
customer_reviews.author: Mountain Doc

customer_reviews.title: and hopefully you can avoid some disappointment.
customer_reviews.text: Well, this WAS a decent waterproof camera, but exactly a year and a half after purchase, the waterproof seal failed and this camera is toast. Turns out there is only a one year warranty and you're basically SOL after that. I advise purchasing something of a little bit higher quality, and hopefully you can avoid some disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Daylight only
customer_reviews.text: I used this in a pool and on the beach and it takes great pictures during the day. However if you want it to be your only camera...The flash can not be relied on for indoor day or any nighttime photos...The quality of the images is very grainy. Not even good for facebook posting. Pretend it doesn't have a flash and just use in in a pool outside on bright days and you will be good.
customer_reviews.author: Mark B.

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Bought this camera for it's waterproof and rugged features. After my third trip to the beach the camera took in water, I only used it in shallow water for snorkelling. I put it down for a month and it seemed to "dry out" and started working again. I now use it as I would a normal digital camera, I may risk getting it splashed but I wouldn't submerge ever again. The night pictures are not that great either, not great for high ISO pictures. Bottom line, good camera for day pictures and light water uses, not great for night pics or, from my experience, submersion.
customer_reviews.author: Elton

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes leaves color casts over pics
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for my 15 year old son for our trip to Mexico. It was great for snorkeling! In underwater mode it would take pictures in such rapid succession you could make a movie! Of course the camera takes video under water as well. It has a great zoom lens and takes very clear photos. The only issue was that sometimes consecutive pics would have a blue color cast to them. I am not sure if it was because my son left it in underwater mode or what. I ended up having to remove some color casts online using Picasa. My husband and I are considering purchasing this camera for ourselves, as well, since it is so affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Amy L.

customer_reviews.title: Don't like that the zoom button is not on or near ...
customer_reviews.text: Don't like that the zoom button is not on or near the button to take the shot. ... The shot button is on the top. The zoom button is on the top of the back face of the camera. I do like that it is waterproof, and somewhat shatter resistant. I felt like this was a great choice for my son. .... I hope it can survive him!
customer_reviews.author: G. Lowery

customer_reviews.title: worth it. worked for me. best of luck for you...
customer_reviews.text: picture quality is substandard compared to more current tech (iphone 4S, canon anything), but I've been lucky enough to have this little guy continue to work through 10+ snorkelling excursions, and get battered around in waves a few times too. It's probably luck of the draw, but this one worked for me and was a great deal for the ability to snap great pics under the sea! My pet theory is that camera manufacturers make up horror stories for the cheaper underwater cameras...but it might just be luck of the draw on your seals.
customer_reviews.author: CL Havas

customer_reviews.title: The features I've used are fine, especially the panaramic shots
customer_reviews.text: I don't do underwater so I can't rate that. The features I've used are fine, especially the panaramic shots. That is neat. The big downer is no instructiom manual, as is the cheap custom today. Yes, it's on a disc but who carries a laptop to the beach or deep in the woods? Yes, I can print it but It's about 70 pages, ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Happy of buying it.
customer_reviews.text: I was searching similar cameras but finally I bought this one. I haven't regret any single day since I have it. The quality of the pictures is very nice, totally waterproof and quite light. It has all I expected from it in a very high quality way, including the video recording. If you're looking for a camera for you adventures in rivers and beaches, this is your camera.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio Barrachina Blasco

customer_reviews.title: Grandma's gift
customer_reviews.text: Grandma's gift was thourghly researched and approved by father and given on Christmas Day to young Grandaughter who had no trouble at all learning to operate and taking picktures of everybody and everything. The family was very pleased with the camera. However, the color given and shown was described as blue but the camera was rather aqua and the blue cost more. I would highly recommend camera for any shutterbug.
customer_reviews.author: savysixty

customer_reviews.title: Shockproof
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera more for its shockproof capabilities than waterproof. I was always dropping cameras and the SD/battery door would break. I use it every day for work 40+ photos. Love the wide angle, I can get much more in the frame. Simple to use one-handed and fits nicely in my top pocket.Long battery life. Picture quality good (plenty good enough for me) This was on offer, saving about $50.00. Price is reasonable even without discount. I would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: great camera
customer_reviews.text: my 8yr old niece love this. Sturdy enough for us not be afraid and watch her and she is happy little photographer. I think if this camera survived 8 years old it will survive adult using it :)
customer_reviews.author: myself

customer_reviews.title: Excellent image
customer_reviews.text: So far I cannot complain: this camera works just fine! I have tried several times under water and even went (accidentally) to 7m depth with no trouble. Obviously the only drawback so far is the limited zoom, but it's part of the design limitation, you cannot have it all... This is an excellent camera to keep in your pocket without worrying about hits or sweat.
customer_reviews.author: Alessio Bembo

customer_reviews.title: So So prosuct.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for the occasional beach vacation. Used it twice already. The second time I used it, the lens were fogging and the camera kept on prompting me to check the batteries. No leaks but will not use it extensively in the water or it might just malfunction for good.
customer_reviews.author: Grumpy

customer_reviews.title: Worked out well as a gift
customer_reviews.text: Got this camera for my boyfriend whom has a knack for breaking cameras (2 in two years!) I love the fact it is designed to withstand drops and water submersion. So far so good, it also takes decent quality video at concerts (after doing research I found out mono recording sound was supposed to sound better.) It arrived timely and like new.
customer_reviews.author: Shena

customer_reviews.title: Excellent camera
customer_reviews.text: Bought this last minute to take on a trip to Hawaii where we did a lot of snorkeling. It did a great job taking pictures under the water...just wish I had discovered there was actually a setting for taking pictures under the water before we took all our underwater pictures!! Even on the auto setting, though, it took great pictures!
customer_reviews.author: karent

customer_reviews.title: Broke after forst water use
customer_reviews.text: This stopped working after using it one time underwater had to send it back. Pretty lame as it happened during a big trip to Australia and so I had no camera after that.
customer_reviews.author: Diane

customer_reviews.title: Great little durable camera
customer_reviews.text: My little girl is 5 years old an absolute shutterbug. She has been asking over and over for a camera so we took the plunge on this model. It is durable, has survived a few large drops already, waterproof, and takes pretty decent pictures. For anyone looking for a great starter camera that can take abuse, this is a great find.
customer_reviews.author: MJH

customer_reviews.title: Made it just past the warrantee
customer_reviews.text: This started out as a good camera for rough, wet, use. However, about two weeks out of warrantee, taking pictures of the grandkids in a splash park, it leaked and lost the display. Camera still works, just can't frame a shot or use the menu. Always made sure the door was properly latched, no dings or dents, don't know where it leaked.
customer_reviews.author: Miner

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for the
customer_reviews.text: This camera is really good for its purpose that is to be used in the water. The pictures one out nice. I cannot expect professional photos out of a p&S camera but the photos from the under water condition is good. My friends like it so much that they bought their own too.
customer_reviews.author: chris Leung

customer_reviews.title: Underwater & Wet Weather capability is nice, but photos are mediocre
customer_reviews.text: Sure, you can tote this anywhere. You might want a float strap, or a tether to ensure that it doesn't fall to the bottom of someplace you can't get to. But the photo quality is mediocre, especially for out-of-water shots. I use this as "my" camera, and my wife keeps the nicer point-and-shoot with her.
customer_reviews.author: zealousagenda

customer_reviews.title: Leaked first time out
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this camera for an extended vacation with my husband. Unfortunately, the camera leaked the first time it was in the water. Never was in sand, triple-checked to make sure the door was shut properly and locked. Didn't even last an hour of snorkeling. Waiting to hear from Panasonic now. I'd prefer to just return it to Amazon but we got home 8 days after the return period ended. If I get no satisfaction from Panasonic, I'll return it for a partial refund and call it an expensive lesson.
customer_reviews.author: M. Bannister

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product. The first camera did not last through our first trip. It was replaced by amazon with the same model. Fast forward to the present and on another trip this camera quits also. I would estimate this replacement camera hasn't taken over 200 pictures total. I sent the camera to the panasonic repair center and they wanted $172 to repair it. I wouldn't spend that kind of money on this camera or any other panasonic camera.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Gant

customer_reviews.title: Not Waterproof!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this camera for our vacation to the Caribbean. We figured having 3 kids, a boat and a Caribbean vacation a tough waterproof camera would be a perfect fit. Our first day on vacation we were taking pics in the pool, after 20 minutes water somehow got in camera and ruined the LCD screen.
customer_reviews.author: Michael W. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great camera!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this camera for a trip to Mexico and absolutely fell in love. Takes AMAZING underwater pictures. Got some pictures of sea turtles way underwater and the pictures are so clear and beautiful. The orange color is great because I can always find it really quickly in my bag among all the other black electronics.
customer_reviews.author: B. Neiski

customer_reviews.title: No waterproof!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought camera to take on island vacation, on in a life time. Took it in Caribbean snorkeling got some great pictures but when we got out of water I turned the camera on to view pictures only to find out camera did not turn on. When I took battery out of camera there was no water inside so I don't know why it shorted out but it's an expensive camera for one use only
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Water plus camera
customer_reviews.text: This was the best idea I've had in a long time! Bought this before trip to Austrailia. It is small, good photos in and out of water. Used in ocean and freshwater. Night and day holiday pics. It required reading instructions well for use and care after under water salt water pics, but indeed best pics we have from three of Us. Kinda would like zoom to be tad easier to use while in a hurry or underwater as could be slow. But still very capable and well used on our trip. Happy we bought it.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: Works very well with good battery life.
customer_reviews.text: This camera is nicely packages for easy carry. The controls are simple and the performance is very good.I bought a spare 1100 ma Wasabi battery for it and found that it has come in very handy during a busy picture taking day. I definitely recommend at least one spare battery!
customer_reviews.author: one

customer_reviews.title: If you got the $$ go for the deeper model
customer_reviews.text: Had to return the first one because the screen went funky after first dive of ten feet or so. Have not had the second one in water yet but will be keeping to the six foot or less water depths. Beyond the screen issue, the pictures were great and the camera was easy to use. I think it would be a great camera for folks that do most of their adventures above water but still get wet on occasion.
customer_reviews.author: JRV

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Had to return it because the picture quality was unacceptable. I did try al the possible setup and did not get any good pics. Is good for a child not for a family vacation. I already bought another one, of course more expensive but worth the money. Thank you amazon for the return policies!
customer_reviews.author: Dan Hach

customer_reviews.title: It's a good water proof camera
customer_reviews.text: I used the camera at Disney World. One hotel has speakers under water in their pool. I used the video option, you can clearly hear music underwater. I used the camera under watetr in daylight, pictures come out great. I have been a little disappointed with the camera's pictures in lower light settings--often they don't come out well compared to other cameras I have used.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof for long
customer_reviews.text: I had this camera 8 months and took it on two trips involving underwater photography, a total of maybe a dozen times in the water. I followed all the instructions. It leaked and stopped working on the first day of the second trip. As others have noted, the manufacturer won't do a thing for you if it leaks.
customer_reviews.author: James Rees

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I took my wife to the Dominican and we planned to go snorkeling so I did some research on wht camera took good underwater pictures. After reading multiple reviews I choose this camera and was super pleased with the results!! Not only is it small and easy to hold, but it took phenomenal pictures! We got remarkable pictures of sharks even up to 15 feet away!
customer_reviews.author: B. W.

customer_reviews.title: Ok, not great, better than a stick in the eye!
customer_reviews.text: This camera is a great size and the fact that it is waterproof, dust proof, and freeze proof is super handy. It would be better if it used regular batteries instead of a specific camera battery. Also, the picture quality in standard auto mode isn't reliable. The panoramic is great! Ok for the price, but it's not the best camera out there.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and ok for snapshots
customer_reviews.text: Used once and held up waterproof after brief submersion in a river. Photos outdoor are acceptable for snapshots. All images are pixelated/noisy. Indoor flash shots are not good (overexposed, reflections). Pros include price, quick shutter and small size. As long as it stays waterproof, I won't complain.
customer_reviews.author: GD

customer_reviews.title: This has been a great little camera
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great little camera. I have had it for two summers now and taken many great pictures and movies of the grandkids swimming in the pool. It takes great pictures underwater and is very simple to use.
customer_reviews.author: papasteve

customer_reviews.title: Love this camera
customer_reviews.text: We have been across this country and about a dozen other and taken some great shots. Good battery life and pictures that come out good under almost any conditions. Sure its not a thousand dollar camera but some of the picture you can take with this cam will make you forget that.
customer_reviews.author: Wonderful Rohr

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Underwater Camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera was great for the money. We took it on our cruise and it really made the trip special. We were able to take pictures in the waterfall and under the water that came out clear as day. It was easy to use and required little set up. Make sure you read the directions on cleaning and drying it after underwater use to ensure it doesn't break. I would recommend this camera to anyone who is looking for an affordable underwater camera.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica S.

customer_reviews.title: Water resistance
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera for its ability to resist water from entering into camera structure. As far as it is producing good quality images and videos..I've seen better and I use different camera when water is not of a matter.
customer_reviews.author: S.A.A.LM

customer_reviews.title: quality of pictures taken is bad!
customer_reviews.text: Most of pictures I took with this camera have bad quality, especially if taken with high iso, I can see quite much noise in the pictures and more often a blur. The colors of pictures are not so bright and less contrasting. Even in daylight the quality of captured pictures is not so good.
customer_reviews.author: Ryne

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: OMG this camera is awesome. Please if you want an underwater camera get this one. Because it is afordable and also gets wonderful photos under the water. We always have wonderful time playing in the water and get some pictures and also videos by using this camera. Definitely suggest it!
customer_reviews.author: BK

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the price
customer_reviews.text: Got this camera and it was amazing while it worked. then after a few months it just stopped working. The flash stopped first then some of the buttons stopped responding, and finally it just stopped takeing pictures. It would turn on and off but that was about it. So I had to send it in for repairs. They ended up just sending out a new camera to me. Hopeing it was a fluke because I loved this camera while it was functional.
customer_reviews.author: Erica Cope

customer_reviews.title: great price
customer_reviews.text: took it Disney last week work great not the best in low light but no cam is unless u spend lots money kids took in the water all day up and down water slides great video and pics in and out of water. the mic work really well underwater too ever night we watch the slideshow by just plugin into a TV and we had a choice of 4 music sound tracks build in to the cam also does good panorama shots too if my 6 yrs old didn't break it run up and down water slide all day it must be pretty tough cons low light but i have a $360 camera and it still has low light isuses
customer_reviews.author: R. K. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Great out-door camera
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this right before our honeymoon; we took it snorkeling, kayaking, ATV-ing, and to the beach. Some of our favorite photos from the trip came from this camera, not our DSLR. Outdoor pics are clear, with crisp colors. Indoors it's not quite as useful; lots of noise, slow focusing. Can't do everything well, but it does quite a few things great.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S.

customer_reviews.title: Truly waterproof, sometimes pictures are blurry
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed that the camera is waterproof as advertised. But for a camera that is supposed to take photos at 16.1 mp, the pictures can be really grainy and sometimes the pictures are blurry, even. It's hard to keep the lens from getting dirty also, which probably contributes to the smudgy looking photographs.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: LOVED IT!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the camera to my 1st out of the country trip, without even testing it. I was pleased and the LIFE of the party, in the water while using this camera. Everyone came to me asking is that waterrpoof,is that water proof, LOL. It's light weight and took WONDERFUL pictures under water!
customer_reviews.author: Beautiful Mee

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera for travel and water play
customer_reviews.text: This camera was just what I wanted for vacation pix. The Amazon price was great. It is safe around the pool and ocean and takes better than average pix almost anywhere. I have it around my wrist whenever I snorkel and love capturing those special underwater discoveries. I have had no problems with it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Joel D

customer_reviews.title: LOVE it
customer_reviews.text: This little camera is super easy to use and the display is large enough to see pretty clearly underwater. We took it diving off the Mexican coast and got great pics. We never had any issues with battery life as some have said, all good and a smart buy for not a lot of money.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Fouts

customer_reviews.title: Fogged up after one use
customer_reviews.text: Got if for Christmas, but didn't use it until May on a trip to the Galapagos Islands. First time in, great. Second time, water must have gotten into the viewing screen, as it fogged up. The camera would take photos, but you couldn't see what you were taking. Not impressed at all.
customer_reviews.author: Deb W.

product_meta.title: Panasonic Lumix TS20 16.1 MP TOUGH Waterproof Digital Camera with 4x Optical Zoom (Orange) (OLD MODEL)
product_meta.description:
Color:OrangeFROM THE MANUFACTURER



PANASONIC LUMIX TS20 16.1 TOUGH WATERPROOF DIGITAL CAMERA WITH 4X OPTICAL ZOOM, SHOCKPROOF, 14ºF FREEZEPROOF, DUSTPROOF & MEGA O.I.S., ORANGE

A STYLISH EXTERIOR AND A TOUGH INTERIOR BODY WITHSTANDS YOUR ADVENTURES
A Waterproof Digital Camera with a Tough Body and Rugged Design for Extreme Shooting! (View Larger)Flat and Slim, the TS20 LUMIX waterproof GPS digital camera shoots in style in any environment. Submerge up to 16ft for underwater fun or beach scenes. Shockproof from 5ft, the TS20 rugged camera lets you shoot with one hand while maintaining your balance. For your hiking or camping trips, the digital camera can withstand fine dust particles, reducing the chance for a malfunction. Simply wash off dirt, soil, and dust with water and you're ready to keep climbing. Shoot while skiing, snowboarding, or skating in temperatures as low as 14.

OUTDOOR SCENES & SHOOTING IN STRONG SUNLIGHT
Set sail and shoot in, around, or under the sun. (View Larger)On the TS20 rugged camera, select the outdoor Scene Mode that best fits your day ahead (like Sports, Snow, Beach & Surf, and Underwater). And with a 2.7-inch LCD not only do you get wide-angle views, you get brightness adjustments in 11 steps and Anti-Reflective AR coating that minimizes glare for better visibility even under strong sunlight or locations with bright daylight.

TAKE A PICTURE AND RECORD IT IN FULL 1280P HD WITH 4.6X ZOOM
On the water or at the campsite: Shoot and Record in Full HD with DOLBY Sound, MP4, and AVCHD.
The waterproof digital camera's Motion Picture button lets you record while taking photos without having to switch modes. Make videos in full HD 1,280 pixels in MP4. MEGA O.I.S. stabilizes images and corrects blur not only for your active shots while walking, swimming, or hiking, even your evening shots will also be. When the camera is in Active Mode, MEGA O.I.S. counters blur by stabilizing images against blur while you record movies or videos for optimal clarity. This is especially useful while walking, hiking, or shooting underwater. Panasonic digital cameras use a technologically advanced optical system where the image is not electronically processed resulting in minimal degradation and higher quality.

ZOOM INTELLIGENCE. WIDE-ANGLES. MINIMIZED SHAKE. FOLDED OPTICS TECHNOLOGY.
The LUMIX DC Vario lens, the heart of a Panasonic TS20 (View Larger)The 16.1-megapixel high-resolution DMC-TS20 waterproof digital camera features a 25mm wide-angle lens with 4x optical zoom (35mm equivalent: 25-100mm). The 25mm ultra wide-angle lens has about twice the shooting area as a standard 35mm lens. Use the digital Intelligent Zoom function to extend your reach to 8x as you record that rock that turns out to be a sea turtle. And with Intelligent Resolution technology, the waterproof digital camera preserves the image quality of your underwater or outdoor scenes as naturally clear shots emerge. MEGA O.I.S. stabilizes your underwater footage and reduces blur. And the Venus Engine revs up the high-speed processing so you won’t miss the action.

SHOOT LIKE A PRO WITH THESE PROFESSIONAL-GRADE CONTROL FEATURES ON THE TS20 DIGITAL CAMERA
Go after those pictures-in-the-making with the TS20's 16.1MP High Sensitivity CCD Sensor and Noise Reduction. (View Larger)The 16.1-megapixel CCD Sensor with its 2-channel signal output structure boasts higher signal transfer speed for the active moments you need to capture that require high performance and fast processing like continuous shooting of the dolphins dancing across the ocean. Image quality is bettered with condensing light thanks to increased lens sensitivity. The CCD sensor and the Intelligent Noise Reduction system in the Venus Engine adjusts photos and videos taken in sensitive areas and creates clear, crisp imagery. You also get quick start-up time with Sonic Speed AF so you can follow sea lions with AF Tracking.

SHOOTING AND PLAYBACK OPTIONS TELL YOUR PHOTOGRAPHIC STORY
Use modes like minature effect to creatively enhance your photos and videos (View Larger)If you want to capture wild animals while they hunting and gathering, prep the TS20 Time Lapse feature to shoot the action over time. For fun, apply Miniature Effect and turn your shots of big fish into tiny fish. A Panorama Shot feature, on the TS20 waterproof digital camera, lets you shoot a 360º view scene. When you playback, use Auto Retouch to adjust the contrast and brightness as you recreate your shot with the touch of a button (great for lightening images taken on a beach at dusk). And in Handheld Night Shot, generate a beautifully illuminated night scene.

AN EASY TO USE DIGITAL CAMERA BECAUSE THE CAMERA DOES THE WORK FOR YOU
Point-and-shoot using an AR Coated LCD as iA detects conditions. (View Larger)In iA (Intelligent Auto) Mode, the camera does all the work, leaving you free to compose shots and record videos. In iA Plus Mode, you have a range of creative settings from Motion Deblur to Scene Detection to Face Detection. The Intelligent Scene Selector senses your environment, automatically selecting the right Scene like Sunset. With Happy Mode, optimize color for brilliant stills. Intelligent Exposure corrects backlighting issues reproducing its natural likeness. And with a 2.7-inch LCD not only do you get wide-angle views, you get brightness adjustments in 11 steps and Anti-Reflective AR coating that minimizes glare for better visibility even outdoors.

A LUMIX CAMERA THAT MAKES SHARING YOUR PHOTOS WITH YOUR SOCIAL MEDIA CIRCLES EASY
Make sure your images make the social circles with easy uploading to Facebook and YouTube. (View Larger)With the LUMIX TS20 waterproof digital camera, upload photos and videos instantly to Facebook and videos to YouTube. Photos or videos recorded in AVCHD on the SD/SDHC/SDXC Memory Cards are easy to view on a Panasonic VIERA TV. The PHOTOfunSTUDIO 8.1 AE makes it possible to sort and organize new photos and videos and those stored on your computer. You can also enjoy making slideshows using varying effects as well as your iTunes library for background music.

ACCESSORIZE AWAY WITH THESE GREAT PANASONIC CAMERA PRODUCTS
16GB Memory Card RP-SDU16GU1K
16GB SD card with intelligent data security, content/media write protection switch, power fail protection and smart data writingBattery DMW-BCK7
Back Up Lithium-Ion Battery for select Panasonic Lumix Digital Cameras.Replacement HDMI Mini Cable RP-CHEM15-K
Replacement high speed HDMI Mini cable with ethernet 4.9ft long, transmits HD digital video up to 1080p resolution in 16-bit color 
PANASONIC POINT AND SHOOT CAMERA COMPARISON CHART
Lumix TS4 Lumix TS20Dimensions (W x H x D)101.0 x 58.3 x 19.2 mm / (3.98 x 2.30 x 0.76 inch)101.0 x 58.3 x 19.2 mm / (3.98 x 2.30 x 0.76 inch)Camera Effective Pixels12.1 Megapixels16.1 MegapixelsOptical Zoom 4.6x4.0xFocal Length f=4.9 - 22.8mm (28 - 128mm in 35mm equiv.) / (30 - 140mm in 35mm equiv. in video recording)f=4.5 - 18.0mm (25 - 100mm in 35mm equiv.) / (29 - 108mm in 35mm equiv. in movie recording)LensLEICA DC VARIO-ELMAR / 10 elements in 8 groups / (5 Aspherical Lenses / 6 Aspherical surfaces / 1 ED Lens)LUMIX DC VARIO / 11 elements in 10 groups / (5 Aspherical Lenses / 9 Aspherical surfaces / 1 ED Lens)Optical Image Stabilizer Power O.I.S. (On with Active Mode (only for motion picture) / Off)MEGA O.I.S. (On with Active Mode (only for motion picture) / Off)Focusing AreaNormal: Wide / Tele 30 cm - infinity / Macro / Intelligent AUTO / motion picture: Wide 5 cm - infinity / Tele 30cm - infinityNormal: Wide 50 cm - infinity / Tele 100cm - infinity / Macro / Intelligent AUTO/ motion picture: Wide 5 cm - infinity / Tele 100cm - infinityMode Dial / Mode ButtonIntelligent AUTO, P, M, Sports, Snow, frames/sec / (recorded in 3M for 4:3, 2.5M for 3:2, 2M for 16:9, 2.5M for 1:1) , Max. 100 images / Time Lapse ShotFull-Resolution Image, approx. 1.3 frames/sec / High-speed Burst Mode: approx. 8 frames/sec / (recorded in 3M for 4:3, 2.5M for 3:2, 2M for 16:9, 2.5M for 1:1) Max. 80 imagesMotion Picture Recording[HD Video] 1920 x 1080 pixels, 60i (GFS: 17Mbps, FSH: 17Mbps / AVCHD) (Sensor
